content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of wine, theater, and revelry, often depicted with grapevines and a crown of ivy leaves?

The god you're referring to is Dionysus. He was the god of wine, theater, fertility, and religious ecstasy in Greek mythology. Dionysus is often depicted holding a thyrsus (a staff topped with a pinecone) and accompanied by maenads and satyrs. His Roman counterpart is Bacchus.
